intro: Pelexia neottiorhiza, commonly known as the Neottianthine pelexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small, white or greenish, with a distinct central stalk. Pelexia neottiorhiza is often found in association with other wetland plants, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
